title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 473.1 - Applications
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 473.1 - Applications

State Regulations

Tax Law, § 502
(a) All applications for permits must be made
on form TMT-1. The application should list all motor vehicles, including
omnibuses, owned or operated by the applicant. A fee of $5 for each motor
vehicle listed should accompany the application. The fee should be paid by
check or money order payable to the State Tax Commission. All the required
information must be set forth in the application blank. The permit form TMT-2
will be completed by the Miscellaneous Tax Bureau for all motor vehicles and
omnibuses. (b) The application and
fee must be mailed or delivered to the State Tax Commission, Miscellaneous Tax

Bureau (see §
470.1
[a], supra
). (c) The

State Tax Commission will approve or reject each application. If approved, permits and stickers will be mailed by the commission to the applicant at the
business address shown on the application, unless the applicant completes the
mailing address provided on the application for mailing of permits to an
address other than the business address of the applicant. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§
473.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
